intro: Cupania furfuracea, commonly known as the hairy cupania, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to South America and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
